summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney Bruce Barket and the US Attorney's Office regarding discovery requests in the case of Nicholas Tartaglione, focusing on the investigation into the July 22-23, 2019 incident where Jeffrey Epstein and Tartaglione were housed together in the SHU at MCC. The document reveals requests for video, photos, and reports related to Epstein's death/cell incident, and the government's responses indicating many requested records do not exist.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione, making discovery requests to the US Attorney's Office regarding the July 22-23 incident involving Jeffrey Epstein and Tartaglione.

persons.name: Aida Leisenring
persons.context: Attorney working with Bruce Barket on the Tartaglione case, mentioned as planning to review materials with Barket.

persons.name: David Ruhnke
persons.context: Resource counsel with whom Barket wants to share notes from review of 'attorneys' eyes only' materials.

persons.name: Tanya Green
persons.context: Resource counsel with whom Barket wants to share notes from review of 'attorneys' eyes only' materials.

persons.name: John Diaz
persons.context: Assistant US Attorney from the Southern District of New York responding to discovery requests regarding the Epstein/Tartaglione incident.

persons.name: Tony Ricco
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on the email correspondence regarding Tartaglione discovery requests.

persons.name: Bruce Koffsky
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on the email correspondence regarding Tartaglione discovery requests.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Former police officer and defendant in a murder case who was housed with Jeffrey Epstein in the SHU at MCC on July 22-23, 2019, and is the subject of the discovery requests.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Financier and accused sex trafficker who was found dead in his cell at MCC on July 23, 2019, while housed with Nicholas Tartaglione in the SHU.

connections.description: Barket is representing Tartaglione in his criminal case and is making discovery requests related to the incident with Epstein.
Both are attorneys working together on the Tartaglione case, planning to review materials together.
Barket seeks to share case notes with Ruhnke, who is resource counsel.
Barket seeks to share case notes with Green, who is resource counsel.
Were housed together in the same cell in the SHU at MCC on the night of July 22-23, 2019, when Epstein died.
Diaz (prosecutor) is responding to discovery requests from Barket (defense attorney) in the Tartaglione case.

events.title: Epstein-Tartaglione Cell Incident
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein and Nicholas Tartaglione were housed together in the same cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, leading to an incident where Epstein was later found dead.

events.title: Government Response to Discovery Requests
events.description: The US Attorney's Office (John Diaz) responds to defense discovery requests regarding the Epstein/Tartaglione incident, indicating many requested records do not exist.

events.title: Defense Follow-up on Discovery
events.description: Bruce Barket follows up on discovery requests, asking about sharing notes with resource counsel and requesting video surveillance and photographs from the July 22-23 incident.

events.title: Scheduled Conference
events.description: A conference is scheduled between the defense and prosecution regarding the Tartaglione case.

locations: 666 Old Country Road, Garden City, NY 11530 (Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco law office)
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York (where Epstein and Tartaglione were housed)
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (US Attorney's Office Southern District of New York)
White Plains, NY (US Attorney's Office location where documents could be reviewed)
keyFacts: The US Attorney's Office confirmed that no audio/video recordings exist of BOP interviews with Nicholas Tartaglione regarding the Epstein incident.
No documentation exists regarding the decision to house Tartaglione and Epstein together in the same SHU cell at MCC.
No After Action Report was prepared by BOP regarding the July 22-23, 2019 incident involving Epstein and Tartaglione.
A 53-page BOP investigative report related to the July 22-23 incident exists but is designated 'Attorney's Eyes Only' with minimal redactions.
The defense was requesting video surveillance outside the cells for the night of July 22-23 and photographs of the cell and both inmates following the incident.
